title: O-Shot® (PRP Shot for Women)
description: Doctor-led platelet-rich plasma injections that restore lubrication, sensitivity, and bladder control.
longDescription: The O-Shot® is a regenerative procedure that uses your own platelet-rich plasma (PRP) to stimulate new blood vessels, nerves, and collagen within the clitoral network, anterior vaginal wall, and periurethral tissues. By enhancing circulation and neurosensory signalling, it improves orgasm intensity, natural lubrication, and mild urinary leakage without hormones or surgery.\n\nAt Dr. SNA Clinic every step—from consultation to aftercare—is handled in private suites by Dr. Syed Nadeem Abbas or our senior female clinicians. We combine dual-spin PRP processing with optional comfort measures and synergistic technologies (Ultra Femme 360, EMSELLA) to create predictable, confidence-building results.

overview.title: What Is the O-Shot?
overview.content: During the O-Shot we take a small sample of your blood, spin it in a medical-grade centrifuge to concentrate growth factors up to 6x baseline, and inject that golden PRP along the clitoris, anterior vaginal wall (G-spot region), and periurethral sling. Growth factors such as PDGF, VEGF, and TGF-β trigger collagen synthesis, nerve sprouting, and microvascular repair.\n\nBecause PRP comes from your own body there is virtually zero risk of allergic reaction. Most women notice easier arousal, richer orgasms, improved lubrication, and reduced urinary urgency within a few weeks.
highlights: Targets nerves, blood flow, and support tissue simultaneously
Comfort-first appointment with optional female chaperone
Pairs well with Ultra Femme 360 or EMSELLA for comprehensive results

howItWorks.title: How the O-Shot Rebuilds Intimate Tissue
howItWorks.subtitle: Growth factors activate collagen, nerves, and microcirculation
howItWorks.content: Platelets release PDGF, VEGF, IGF, FGF, and TGF-β the moment they contact tissue. These messengers recruit stem cells, stimulate fibroblasts, and form new microvessels. Injecting concentrated PRP into intimate tissue amplifies this healing cascade exactly where you need it.

steps.description: PRP placed along the clitoris, anterior wall, and periurethral tissue using ultra-fine needles.

faq.question: How soon can I have intercourse after the O-Shot?
faq.answer: You can resume intimacy the same day. Some women prefer to wait 24 hours if there is mild swelling, but it is not medically required.

faq.question: Will it hurt?
faq.answer: Topical anaesthetic, vibration therapy, and optional nitrous oxide keep discomfort to a mild pressure sensation that lasts seconds.

faq.question: How long do the results last?
faq.answer: Most patients enjoy benefits for 12-18 months. We offer booster sessions annually if you want to maintain peak results.

faq.question: Is it safe if I’m on HRT?
faq.answer: Yes. We review your hormone plan and coordinate with your prescribing doctor. PRP is autologous and compatible with HRT.

faq.question: Can the O-Shot help with lichen sclerosus?
faq.answer: PRP reduces inflammation and improves tissue integrity. We usually combine it with LED light therapy and compounded barrier creams for chronic LS.

faq.question: Do you offer payment plans?
faq.answer: 0% finance is available over 6–12 months. Our coordinators can arrange approvals during your consultation.
